lesson_html:
Python supports basic mathematical operators similar to C#, with some slight syntax variations:

Arithmetic Operators

  • + Addition (like C# '+')
  • - Subtraction (like C# '-')
  • * Multiplication (like C# '*')
  • / Division (returns float, unlike C#'s integer division)
  • // Integer Division (similar to C#'s integer division)
  • % Modulo (remainder, like C# '%')
  • ** Exponentiation (in C#, use Math.Pow())

Examples

x = 10 + 5    # Addition: 15
y = 20 - 7     # Subtraction: 13
z = 4 * 3     # Multiplication: 12
a = 15 / 2    # Float Division: 7.5
b = 15 // 2   # Integer Division: 7
c = 15 % 2    # Modulo: 1
d = 2 ** 3    # Exponentiation: 8
